alert.note: Alert for Caledonia (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 11:49PM EDT until July 11 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Orange and Washington. In northeast Vermont, Caledonia. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peacham, Ricker State Park, Groton Village, Groton, Ryegate, Barnet, Topsham, Cabot, Danville, Newbury, Wells River Village, Marshfield, Walden, Orange, Plainfield, South Peacham, West Barnet, East Peacham, West Groton and Stillwater State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
